transcript.text: Legal agreements like nondisclosure agreements are one way we can make sure that others protect the information we share with them. Click on each reveal button to learn more.

contentText.text: Nondisclosure agreements, or NDAs, are an effective way to make sure confidential information shared with a third party remains confidential.

instructionText.text: Click on each reveal button to learn more.
Click on Next (bottom right arrow) to continue.

popText.text: Use an NDA if you are sharing confidential information with anyone outside the company. Never disclose confidential information before an NDA is signed. Johnson Controls Law department can provide templates for different situations.

flipCard.buttonImg: Person reviewing a Non Disclosure Agreement

popText.text: Sometimes, outside companies may offer to use their own NDAs. Don’t accept. We can accept them only after legal review and approval, since such third-party NDAs will be written to protect the third party’s interests, not ours.

flipCard.buttonImg: Supervisor explaining NDA uses to employee

popText.text: At times, we may sign an NDA to protect another company’s information. If so, it’s critical to ensure that we take the necessary steps to comply with our responsibilities, otherwise we could be sued for breach of agreement. Make sure anyone working with the information is aware of our obligations to protect it.
